cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles east-northeast of Tampico, Mexico and 255 miles southeast of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northeast through Saturday, then turning slowly westward toward the central-upper Texas coast early next week

weather_observation.impacted_coast: western Gulf Coast of Mexico and much of the Texas coastline; lower probabilities extend eastward to Louisiana and Mississippi coasts
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; less than 5 % chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected along the Mississippi coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional outer-band showers could bring 1â€“2 inches of rain late weekend into early next week.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip currents along Mississippi barrier islands.
